data.title: Mira Nair to Shekhar Kapur: Indian directors who have made Hollywood films
data.meta_description: These are the Indian directors who have directed Hollywood films. Mira Nair directed The Namesake in 2006, featuring Kal Penn, Irrfan Khan, Tabu and Jacinda Barrett in the lead
data.text:
Broken Horses is a 2015 crime thriller film directed by Vidhu Vinod Chopra, featuring Anton Yelchin and Chris Marquette in the lead

Mr. India director Shekhar Kapur helmed Hollywood films like Elizabeth (1998) and its sequel, Elizabeth: The Golden Age (2007)

Deepa Mehta, who is known for her directorial ventures like Sam & Me and Camilla, also helmed the documentary At 99: A Portrait of Louise Tandy Murch (1976)

The Lunchbox director, Ritesh Batra, helmed Our Souls at Night (2017), featuring Robert Redford and Jane Fonda in prominent roles
